summary: The Homes for Every Local Protector, Educator, and Responder Act of 2025 (HELPER Act of 2025) amends the National Housing Act to establish a mortgage insurance program. This program, administered by the Secretary, offers mortgage insurance to eligible first responders (law enforcement, firefighters, paramedics, EMTs, and teachers) who are first-time homebuyers to purchase or repair a home. Key features include no down payment requirement, an upfront mortgage insurance premium, and authorization of appropriations for the program's operation.
